short_summary: UXO Removal and Disposal - Lac Saint-Pierre (QC)
description: The work includes, but is not necessarily limited to, the supply of labour, material, supervision and equipment necessary to investigate anomalies over a two-year period, remove and dispose of the items creating the anomalies (including detonating projectiles), and carry out geophysical surveys at Lac St-Pierre, Nicolet (Quebec).

full_summary:
# UXO Removal and Disposal at Lac Saint-Pierre (Quebec)

## Tender Notice

### Project Overview

The Defence Construction Canada (DCC) invites bids for the UXO Removal and Disposal at Lac Saint-Pierre, Quebec. This project aims to remove and dispose of unexploded ordnance (UXO) and conduct geophysical surveys over a two-year period.

### Tender Details

- **Amendment Number**: 3
- **Contracting Entity**: Defence Construction Canada - Region of Quebec
- **Contracting Entity Address**: 2030 Boulevard Pie-IX, Bureau 224, Montreal, QC H1V 2C8
- **Tender Closing Date**: June 29, 2023 2:00 PM EDT
- **Estimated Cost**: Approximately $5,250,000
- **Work Period**: No later than 730 calendar days after contract award

### Technical Requirements

The work involves investigating anomalies, removing and disposing of UXO, and conducting geophysical surveys. The successful bidder must provide labor, materials, supervision, and equipment necessary to complete the project.

### Bidding and Documents

Tender documents are available on the MERX website (merx.com). Bidders can access the documents by registering on the website or by calling 1 (800) 964-MERX. A site visit has been canceled.

### Submission and Evaluation

Bidders must submit their proposals to the designated contracting authority only. Inquiries and questions should be directed to the contracting authority, and bidders who contact anyone else may be disqualified.

### Contract Award and Result

The Defence Construction Canada will award the contract to the successful bidder. A preliminary announcement of the tender results will be made available on the MERX website.

### Official Language

This project is conducted in accordance with the requirements outlined in the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA). The official language of the project is English. Resumes and cover letters should be in English.

Note to visitors: This is a national government contract. Bidders are responsible for understanding the tender and bid accordingly. Defence Construction Canada is not responsible for the accuracy of the translated text. 400 words.
